# Introduction to Quarto

## What is Quarto?

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
### Publishing System by Rstudio

-   Based on R Markdown (= R Markdown with even more even features)
-   Able to execute code
-   Supports multiple programming languages
-   Integrated in Rstudio
:::
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
### Usecases

-   [Articles/Reports](https://quarto-dev.github.io/quarto-gallery/page-layout/tufte.html)
-   [Websites](https://nasa-openscapes.github.io)
-   **Presentations**
-   ["Books"](https://lennartwittkuhn.com/version-control-book/)
:::
:::
:::

::: {.notes}
2. Very new (2022)
Created by rstudio´s  creators - like r markdown but for even more features
E.g. Python code, Javascript, languages that dont even exist yet
able to render markdown files
:::

## Markdown {{< fa brands-markdown >}}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
-   Easy to use
-   "Markup" Language
-   Content and formatting are integrated instead of seperated
-   Can be an **alternative to using `.docx` files**
-   Used by text editors, GitHub (README), message tools...
-   Integrated in Rstudio as "R Markdown"
:::
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
### E.g.: [HedgeDoc:](https://pad.uni-hamburg.de/5DfbDxjNS_isWT8_S0S-2w?both)

<iframe src="https://hedgedoc.org" width="100%" height="500px">

</iframe>
:::
:::
:::

::: {.notes}

Markup Language. = text encoding system readable by machine
Pros: easier to use for quick notes, faster to write since format and content intertwined, and version control, faster - less loading 
cons: less formatting options since its intentionally simple, e.g. tables pretty complex to do, or pictures  less intuitive (once used to word)

Used by: GitHub, Slack Discord, Reddit 
Hedgedoc = open source markdown editor 
Formerly knows as CodiMD 

R markdown = designed to be used with R from Rstudio , integration of R code, create documents which include code, widely used in scientific community 
:::

# YAML header

## YAML

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
-   ***Y**AML **A**in´t **M**arkup **L**anguage*
-   **Document Settings:** YAML sets up document settings like *title*, *author*, and *output format*.
-   **Customization:** Use YAML for custom themes and styling.
-   [**Themes:**](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-themes.html) E.g. default, morph or pulse
:::
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
### Examples

``` yaml
---
title: "Document title"
author: "Your Name"
theme: vapor
format: pdf
--- 
```
:::

::: fragment
``` yaml
---
title: "{{< var title >}}"
subtitle: |
  {{< var subtitle >}}
  
  [{{< fa display >}} Slides]({{< var website >}}) |
  [{{< fa brands github >}} Source]({{< var source >}})
  
  {{< var license-badge >}}
  {{< var doi-badge >}}
theme: default
date: today
---
```
:::
:::
:::

::: {.notes}
YAML: Datenformat in konfiguartionsdateien, noch viele andere Anwendungsmöglichkeiten,  Metadata for files, today only author, title and output format and Theme
Could also do e.g. date_: 
:::

::: footer
Sources: [RStudio - Markdown basics](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html), [Dr. Monwinckels - Quartaki - 6 hour introduction ro Quarto](https://drmowinckels.github.io/quartaki/)
:::

# Code chunks

## Code chunks

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
-   **Executable Code:** Quarto files support code execution during rendering.
-   Code chunks can be interactive
-   **Customizable Options:** Specify various options for code chunks
-   **Complex Code Supported:** Handle as complex code as needed
-   You can also use *inline code*
-   R code enclosed by ```` ```{r} code  ``` ````
:::
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
::: fragment
### Examples

##### Input


```{r output=FALSE}
#| label: code-example

x <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)
y <- c(2, 4, 1, 3, 5)
plot(x, y, main = "Scatter Plot Example", xlab = "X-Axis", ylab = "Y-Axis")
```

:::

::: fragment
##### Output

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, paged.print=TRUE}
x <- c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)
y <- c(2, 4, 1, 3, 5)
plot(x, y, main = "Scatter Plot Example", xlab = "X-Axis", ylab = "Y-Axis")
```
:::
:::
:::

# Extra features

## Referencing

-   You can name objects like figures, tables...
-   E.g. like this: @sec-citations (`@sec-citations`)

| Type         | Label Prefix |
|--------------|--------------|
| Figures      | fig-         |
| Tables       | tbl-         |
| Equations    | eq-          |
| Sections     | sec-         |
| Code listing | lst-         |
| Theorem      | thm-         |

::: footer
Sources: [RStudio - Markdown basics](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html), [Dr. Monwinckels - Quartaki - 6 hour introduction ro Quarto](https://drmowinckels.github.io/quartaki/)
:::

## Citations {#sec-citations}

-   Can be added via `insert -> citation`
-   Can also be added directly with `@`
-   Are stored in bibtex files in your project

+----------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| Markdown Format                              | Output (author-date format)                                  |
+==============================================+==============================================================+
| ```                                          | Blip blop bloop [see @biswal2010, pp. 33-35; also , chap. 1] |
| Blip blop bloop [see @biswal2010, pp. 33-35; |                                                              |
| also @ggseg, chap. 1]                        |                                                              |
| ```                                          |                                                              |
+----------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| ```                                          | Blip blop bloop [@biswal2010, pp. 33-35, 38-39 and passim]   |
| Blip blop bloop [@biswal2010, pp. 33-35,     |                                                              |
| 38-39 and passim]                            |                                                              |
| ```                                          |                                                              |
+----------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| ```                                          | Blip blop bloop [@ggseg; @biswal2010].                       |
| Blip blop bloop [@ggseg; @biswal2010].       |                                                              |
| ```                                          |                                                              |
+----------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| ```                                          | Mowinckel says blah [-@ggseg]                                |
| Mowinckel says blah [-@ggseg]                |                                                              |
| ```                                          |                                                              |
+----------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+
| ```                                          | @biswal2010 says bloop.                                      |
| @biswal2010 says bloop.                      |                                                              |
| ```                                          |                                                              |
+----------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------+

::: footer
Sources: [RStudio - Markdown basics](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html), [Dr. Monwinckels - Quartaki - 6 hour introduction ro Quarto](https://drmowinckels.github.io/quartaki/)

# Git integration

## Using Git with `.qmd` files

### Features

-   **Plain Text Files:** `.qmd` files are plain text, ensuring compatibility with git diff for effective version control.

- **Branching and Merging:** Use Git's branching and merging capabilities to manage complex document edits.

- **Conflict Resolution:** Resolve conflicts efficiently when collaborating on .qmd files

-  **RStudio Integration:** RStudio offers a graphical user interface (GUI) for Git integration

## GitHub actions
- **Workflow Automation** Can automate various tasks, including document generation.

- **Trigger Events:** Specify events, such as pushes or pull requests, to trigger document generation automatically.

- Can allow you to easily update website built with Quarto (hosted with GitHub pages)
